intro: Calais bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's calais, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
